title: Booed by fans , shielded by security : Donald Trump marks assassination anniversary at FIFA Club World Cup ; crowns Chelsea as winners
body_text:
Booed by fans, shielded by security: Donald Trump marks assassination anniversary at FIFA Club World Cup; crowns Chelsea as winners
Trump was joined by his family and advisers at the tournament, and he also presented medals to players and handed the championship trophy to the team Chelsea on Sunday. According to reports, the couple arrived flying over the stadium in Marine One before taking their seats alongside FIFA President Gianni Infantino and his wife, Leena Al Ashqar.
Moreover, the stadium with a seating capacity of about 80,000 people was hosting the final match between Paris Saint-Germain and Chelsea FC.
Donald Trump was welcomed with loud boos at the FIFA Club World Cup Final
The appearance of Trump at the FIFA Club World Cup Final received a mixed reaction from fans at the stadium. The president attended the event in his trademark red tie and was seen standing beside FIFA President Gianni Infantino to hand over the trophy to Chelsea captain Reece James.
He smiled and cheered for the players as they celebrated their victory. However, as he walked onto the pitch for the presentation, loud boos were also heard among the loud applause from the crowd.

Donald Trump attends the FIFA Club final after one year of assassination attempt
Apart from the Trump family, other notable personalities present in the VIP box at MetLife included Attorney General Pam Bondi, Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy, Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem, media executive Rupert Murdoch, and former football star Tom Brady.
The game was attended by President Donald Trump. PSG entered the match as clear favourites, having just arrived in the United States following their UEFA Champions League triumph that included a dominant 4-0 victory over Real Madrid in the semi-finals.
Donald Trump's assassination attempt in 2024
On July 13, 2024, eight shots were fired at Donald Trump during a public rally. One bullet grazed his ear, causing heavy bleeding. Well, at first, people feared that he had been hit several times.
However, the retired firefighter Corey Comperatore was killed in the crowd, and two others were left wounded.
Marking the anniversary (July 13, 2025) of the assassination attempt, a new Government Accountability Office (GAO) report has highlighted multiple critical errors made by the Secret Service both leading up to and during the Butler rally.
Donald Trump's presence at key sports events
Meanwhile, the president has said that he plans to attend multiple matches during next year's World Cup as he maintains a close relationship with Gianni Infantino, the FIFA head. Moreover, since he took office earlier this year, Trump has made sports events a key part of his public appearances.
Lately, he attended the Super Bowl in New Orleans, the Daytona 500 in Florida, UFC fights in Miami and Newark, and the NCAA wrestling championships in Philadelphia.
Cole Palmer shone as the star performer from Chelsea in the FIFA Club World Cup Finals
If we see the match stats, it is important to note that Cole Palmer from Chelsea scored two goals and made another as Chelsea stunned Paris Saint-Germain in the final of the Club World Cup on Sunday, beating the European champions 3-0.
Palmer opened the scoring midway through the first half and struck again to make it two on the half-hour mark.
